author: hwright
msg: Implement, in a very hacky and unoptimized way, merge sensitive blame.  Our
initial strategy here is basically to run svn_ra_get_file_revs2() twice, once
with the merged revisions, once without, and then merge the resulting blame
chunks and present that to the caller.  This is not very efficient (but doesn't
result in performance penalties for stock 'svn blame'), and there is much work
yet to be done, but this implements the basic functionality as a baseline for
(struct blame): Add a pointer to the merged_revision.
(blame_create): Accept a value for the merged_revision.
(svn_client_blame4): If merged blame information is requested, use
svn_ra_get_file_revs2() to fetch the revisions with the merging revisions
included.  Merge those blame chunks with blame chunks from the strict file
revision set and send the result to the caller.
(test_list): Unmark the 'svn blame -g' test as XFail.

author: lgo
msg: Followup on r26065: fix copy_tests 14 (again), handling of binary properties

author: hwright
msg: Add subversion/libsvn_diff/diff_memory.c, because of a botched merge in
